001package io.github.ai4ci.functions;
002
003import java.util.ArrayList;
004import java.util.List;
005import java.util.SortedMap;
006import java.util.TreeMap;
007
008import org.immutables.value.Value;
009
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnore;
011
012/**
013 * A compact representation of paired coordinates with optional link
014 * transformations for each axis and duplicate handling.
015 *
016 * <p>
017 * Main purpose: provide a small value type that accepts raw x/y arrays, applies
018 * domain and range link functions, filters points to a bounded support and
019 * produces cleaned coordinate arrays suitable for monotone spline fitting.
020 *
021 * <p>
022 * Key features:
023 * <ul>
024 * <li>Apply independent {@link LinkFunction} transforms to x and y data</li>
025 * <li>Filter points to a configurable support window</li>
026 * <li>Resolve duplicate transformed x-values by mean, max or min</li>
027 * <li>Produce derived arrays {@link #getHx()} and {@link #getHy()} used by
028 * spline builders and interpolators</li>
029 * </ul>
030 *
031 * <p>
032 * Downstream uses: consumed by
033 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.functions.EmpiricalDistribution} when preparing data
034 * for spline fitting, and by
035 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.functions.SplineInterpolator} for constructing
036 * monotone cubic splines.
037 *
038 * @author Rob Challen
039 */
040@Value.Immutable
041public interface Coordinates {
042
043        /**
044         * Resolution strategies for duplicate transformed x keys.
045         */
046        public static enum DuplicateResolution {
047                /**
048                 * When multiple original points map to the same transformed x value,
049                 * compute the mean of their y values.
050                 */
051                MEAN,
052                /**
053                 * When multiple original points map to the same transformed x value, take
054                 * the maximum of their y values.
055                 */
056                MAX,
057                /**
058                 * When multiple original points map to the same transformed x value, take
059                 * the minimum of their y values.
060                 */
061                MIN
062        }
063
064        /**
065         * Returns the transformed x-coordinates after applying the x link and
066         * aggregating duplicates according to {@link #resolveDuplicates()}.
067         *
068         * @return an array of transformed x values suitable for spline fitting
069         */
070        @Value.Derived @JsonIgnore
071        public default double[] getHx() {
072                return this.getMapping().keySet().stream().mapToDouble(d -> d).toArray();
073        }
074
075        /**
076         * Returns the transformed y values corresponding to {@link #getHx()}. If
077         * multiple original points map to the same transformed x the values are
078         * combined according to {@link #resolveDuplicates()}.
079         *
080         * @return an array of transformed y values aligned with {@link #getHx()}
081         */
082        @Value.Derived @JsonIgnore
083        public default double[] getHy() {
084                return this.getMapping().values().stream().mapToDouble(list -> {
085                        if (this.resolveDuplicates().equals(DuplicateResolution.MEAN)) {
086                                return list.stream().mapToDouble(d -> d).average().getAsDouble();
087                        }
088                        if (this.resolveDuplicates().equals(DuplicateResolution.MAX)) {
089                                return list.stream().mapToDouble(d -> d).max().getAsDouble();
090                        } else if (this.resolveDuplicates().equals(DuplicateResolution.MIN)) {
091                                return list.stream().mapToDouble(d -> d).min().getAsDouble();
092                        } else {
093                                throw new RuntimeException();
094                        }
095                }).toArray();
096        }
097
098        private SortedMap<Double, List<Double>> getMapping() {
099                SortedMap<Double, List<Double>> out = new TreeMap<>();
100                for (var i = 0; i < this.getX().length; i++) {
101                        var x = this.getX()[i];
102                        var y = this.getY()[i];
103                        if (x <= this.getXMax() && x >= this.getXMin() && y <= this.getYMax()
104                                        && y >= this.getYMin()) {
105                                var tx = this.getXLink().fn(x);
106                                var ty = this.getYLink().fn(y);
107                                out.putIfAbsent(tx, new ArrayList<>());
108                                out.get(tx).add(ty);
109                        }
110                }
111                if (this.isIncreasing()) {
112                        out.putIfAbsent(
113                                        this.getXLink().fn(this.getXMin()),
114                                        List.of(this.getYLink().fn(this.getYMin()))
115                        );
116                        out.putIfAbsent(
117                                        this.getXLink().fn(this.getXMax()),
118                                        List.of(this.getYLink().fn(this.getYMax()))
119                        );
120                }
121                return out;
122        }
123
124        /**
125         * The raw x coordinate array.
126         *
127         * @return an array of x values in the original domain order
128         */
129        public double[] getX();
130
131        /**
132         * The link function applied to x coordinates prior to processing.
133         *
134         * @return the {@link LinkFunction} for the x axis
135         */
136        public LinkFunction getXLink();
137
138        /**
139         * Upper bound of the x support used when mapping points. Defaults to the
140         * maximum support of the x link function.
141         *
142         * @return the maximum x value considered for mapping
143         */
144        @Value.Default
145        default double getXMax() { return this.getXLink().getMaxSupport(); }
146
147        /**
148         * Lower bound of the x support used when mapping points. Defaults to the
149         * minimum support of the x link function.
150         *
151         * @return the minimum x value considered for mapping
152         */
153        @Value.Default
154        default double getXMin() { return this.getXLink().getMinSupport(); }
155
156        /**
157         * The raw y coordinate array corresponding to {@link #getX()}.
158         *
159         * @return an array of y values where {@code getY()[i]} pairs with
160         *         {@code getX()[i]}
161         */
162        public double[] getY();
163
164        /**
165         * The link function applied to y coordinates prior to processing.
166         *
167         * @return the {@link LinkFunction} for the y axis
168         */
169        public LinkFunction getYLink();
170
171        /**
172         * Upper bound of the y support used when mapping points. Defaults to the
173         * maximum support of the y link function.
174         *
175         * @return the maximum y value considered for mapping
176         */
177        @Value.Default
178        default double getYMax() { return this.getYLink().getMaxSupport(); }
179
180//      static Map<Coordinates, SortedMap<Double,List<Double>>> CACHE = new HashMap<>();
181//
182//      default SortedMap<Double,List<Double>> getMapping() {
183//              return CACHE.computeIfAbsent(this, Coordinates::mapped);
184//      }
185
186        /**
187         * Lower bound of the y support used when mapping points. Defaults to the
188         * minimum support of the y link function.
189         *
190         * @return the minimum y value considered for mapping
191         */
192        @Value.Default
193        default double getYMin() { return this.getYLink().getMinSupport(); }
194
195        /**
196         * Whether the x values are strictly increasing. If true additional boundary
197         * points based on {@link #getXMin()}/{@link #getXMax()} and
198         * {@link #getYMin()}/{@link #getYMax()} are inserted to guarantee full
199         * domain coverage for monotone interpolators.
200         *
201         * @return {@code true} if x is increasing, {@code false} otherwise
202         */
203        public boolean isIncreasing();
204
205        /**
206         * Strategy used when multiple transformed x values collide after applying
207         * {@link #getXLink()} (duplicate transformed keys).
208         *
209         * @return the duplicate resolution policy
210         */
211        @Value.Default
212        default DuplicateResolution resolveDuplicates() {
213                return DuplicateResolution.MEAN;
214        }
215
216}
